Posts.Content: Jeannie44 wrote: Jeannie44 rarely posted on this forum, but her husband (me) followed it everyday and found it inspirational to read the stories of hope while educating myself of the various treatment options.  On November 30, 2007 at 11:48am, Jeannie44 finally beat and destroyed the breast cancer monster that consumed us for over 2 years and, went to heaven at the same time.   She died while in the loving arms of her husband surrounded by her family and friends. I could of posted this announcement on many of the forums for she started out having IDC that spread and became Inflammatory Breast Cancer after her mastectomy surgery a year ago December.   She was also a triple negative.   But after 2 recurrences of her cancer, I found myself mostly reading this forum.   The cancer spread to her lungs and she passed due to a combination of the cancer and pleural effusion build up.   She had several draining procedures over the past month and also suffered from a very painful wound that consumed a large area her chest, side, and back from the cancer. Jeannie was a beautiful lady of only 44 years old.  We traveled the country to find a cure for her aggressive disease including Indiana University Medical Center, Dana Farber, Cancer Treatment Center of America near Chicago, and finally found some hope at MD Anderson at their Inflammatory Breast Cancer Clinic.  The doctors there are wonderful and never gave up when one treatment failed.   Jeannie became the subject of many different clinical trials including Avastin, lapatamib (sp?), Imexon, and finally Sutent/Rotuxin.   Along the way she was treated with AC, Taxol, Taxotere, Carboplatin, and several others.   During this time she never gave up and tackled each treatment as if this was the miracle cure we were looking for.   Jeannie was a leader in our community having started her own CPA firm and volunteered in many charitable organization.  Before she passed, she started an Endowment for local high school students to travel on missionary trips.   She leaves behind 2 daughters (age 21 and age 18) and a loving husband who already misses her very much.      Thank you lady's for this forum and I also feel Bimmer's pain.   God Bless all of you.  Goodbye Jeannie44! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Jeannie44 Jeannie44 73gr

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2007 02:13PM Jeannie44 wrote: Bimmer I am so sorry..I know how you feel.   Jeannie44 - Nov 30, 2007.  Signed her husband
Posts.Title: Very advanced B.C.: Diane's final gift. Bimmer ilenee
